Name: Statuette of a woman sitting on a seat
Description: This statuette, which dates to the Ptolemaic Period (compare with Brussels E.3073), represents a woman sitting on a seat with a short back, which has the form of the hieroglyphic sign serving to reproduce the word "set" (seat) and the name of the goddess Isis. The woman, wearing a wig in three parts, is clothed in a round-necked long dress. On the four sides of the seat one notices grids, which seems to indicate that the statuette was used as a model by sculptors.
